references.paper_title: Understanding and improving fast adversarial training
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational understanding of adversarial training, which is the core subject of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Slope meets lasso: improved oracle bounds and optimality
references.reason: This paper establishes improved oracle bounds and optimality for high-dimensional linear regression, which is a key theoretical component in analyzing the convergence rate of the adversarial training estimator.

references.paper_title: Square-root lasso: pivotal recovery of sparse signals via conic programming
references.reason: This paper introduces the square-root lasso, a method used to recover sparse signals in high dimensions, which is relevant to the high-dimensional setting of the present paper.

references.paper_title: Simultaneous analysis of lasso and dantzig selector
references.reason: This paper provides a simultaneous analysis of the lasso and dantzig selector, two popular methods in high-dimensional regression, which are closely related to the adversarial training estimator.

references.paper_title: Minimax rates of estimation for high-dimensional linear regression over lq-balls
references.reason: This paper establishes the minimax rates of estimation for high-dimensional linear regression, which are used as a benchmark for the optimality of the proposed adversarial training estimator.
